Title: Senior Sales Associate (Part Time or Full Time) - St. Jacobs Market District - Kitchener, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Senior Sales Associate – Part Time or Full Time availability
Market Road Antiques is a consignment-based antiques boutique located in the Farmers’ Market District. We provide space to hundreds of local antique dealers.
We are seeking a Senior Sales Associate with superior customer service experience and the ability to achieve daily sales targets all while demonstrating a passion for antiques. They will also be responsible for opening and closing the store – hours of which are Monday – Sunday 10am-6pm.
In addition, the position involves collaborating with the Store Manager and the Marketing and Events Coordinator to formulate new customer offerings and experiences in an effort to promote Market Road Antiques and drive sales. This position will also support the online store and it’s social media channels.
Required Skills/Qualifications:
A minimum of 2 years customer service experience ideally in a retail store environment.
Passionate about antiques
Excellent organizational and verbal skills
Basic computer skills
Cash handling and inventory/sales auditing experience
Point of sale automated systems experience
Merchandise maintenance and visual merchandising
Must be able to lift at least 10 lbs
Must be able to walk 7 km in an 8-hour shift
How we support our Team Members:
Benefits
Access to our Employee Family Assistance Program
Vacation accrual
Team appreciation events
Retirement Savings
Work hours are negotiable with the successful candidate – full time and part time roles both available. Wage is $17.50 per hour. We thank all interested candidates. However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. **
Schlegel Urban Development is pleased to accommodate individual needs in accordance with the Accessibility of Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005 (AODA), within our recruitment process. If you require accommodation at any time throughout the recruitment process, please speak with the hiring leader.
**

Title: Cafeteria Cashier/Server - Barrie, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
POSITION: Cafeteria Cashier/Server
DEPARTMENT: Food & Beverage
REPORTS TO: Quick Service Outlets Manager
STATUS OF POSITION: Seasonal
WHO WE ARE: At Horseshoe Resort, we are a team that loves to serve people, priding ourselves on the service that our colleagues deliver to our guests. Horseshoe Resort is always looking for talented individuals to join our growing team of hospitality professionals and recreation enthusiasts. If you are outgoing, friendly and love adventure and the outdoors, you may be the person we are looking for!
Position Summary
The Cafeteria Cashier & Server is responsible for counter service and running the cash for the cafeteria operated in the busy winter months in a quick, prompt and efficient manner. The Cafeteria Cashier & Server will clean and maintain all areas within the cafeteria in accordance with Health & Safety requirements, and ensure that all supplies are stocked and available for business.
Duties and Responsibilities:
Serve food and beverages
Handle cash and card transactions
Maintain the appearance of the outlet; including cleaning food service area, wiping down and tidying chairs and tables, emptying garbage cans etc.
Restock all items needed to serve guests
Approach every task with enthusiasm, energy and a positive attitude
Strive to deliver outstanding results
Always try to anticipate and exceed guest expectations
Help out in other areas when necessary
Qualifications:
- Comfortable handling cash and card and making change for customers
- Outgoing and friendly personality!
- Ability to work weekdays, evenings, weekends, and holidays
Join our team today, and enjoy employee perks such as Resort staff pass for yourself and your dependents, retail, lodging, and restaurant discounts, along with additional perks and discounts at our affiliated resort – Deerhurst Resort in Muskoka.
Application deadline: 2021-12-03
Expected start date: 2021-11-26
Job Types: Part-time, Temporary, Contract
Salary: $14.35 per hour
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Day shift
Holidays
Monday to Friday
Night shift
Weekend availability

Title: Customer Service Associate - Etobicoke, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
For over 100 years, we have been the engine that drives the Ontario horse racing industry. From King’s and Queen’s trips to Canada, to first dates, anniversaries and unforgettable horse races, we create winning experiences for all our guests.
Join a certified Great Place to Work team and be part of the future of horse racing and entertainment. Access exciting programs that can help unlock your potential while developing challenging and rewarding career goals. As we grow, we need dedicated people to join our cause. Be part of Woodbine Entertainment and get inspired to make work awesome!
Our Values & Beliefs
| WOW EVERY GUEST | OWN IT! | LISTEN & CONNECT – PEOPLE MATTER | FUEL THE FUN & PASS IT ON | TRUST IN OUR TEAM | #WE CARE | PURSUE YOUR POTENTIAL |BE BOLD| BE ALL IN |
Woodbine Entertainment is growing and we are currently looking for a Retail Attendant who is fun, customer-focused and committed to providing our guests with winning experiences!
This position is extremely important to Woodbine’s success. By working together with your team members, you will exceed our guests’ expectations each and every time and most importantly, have fun while doing so.
Your main responsibilities will be to address all customer product and service needs and be required to accurately process all customer transactions through OLG lottery terminal and point of sale systems.
Our ideal candidate is going to have a strong passion to wow our guests, great communication skills, a friendly and outgoing attitude, be able to work in a fast paced environment and be willing to maximize their potential. At Woodbine, the opportunities are endless, so come join a company that makes work awesome!
What are we looking for:
Must be able to work day, evening and overnight shifts
Proven ability to deal professionally and courteously with customers
Working knowledge of cash register and tendering procedures
Proven accuracy in performing basic mathematical calculations
Ability to communicate effectively in English (oral and written)
Ensure uniform and appearance consistently comply with conpany standards
Consistently uphold and demonstrate safety rules and standards as designated by
Available to work all shifts
Guided by our Values and Beliefs, Woodbine Entertainment commits to providing an authentic and empowering work experience! Please reach out if you're ready to embrace change and be part of a new breed of experience while working for one of Canada’s certified Great Places to Work!

Title: Gas Station Attendant - Listowel, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
About us
UPI Listowel is a small business in Listowel, ON. We are engaging and fun.
Our work environment includes:
Modern office setting
Company perks
With over 35 locations across Ontario, our Gas Bars are ready to provide you with an exceptional full service experience.* At our Full Serve locations, we will clean your windows, check your fluids, and bring convenience items directly to you in the comfort of your vehicle.
Replenish more than your fuel tank at UPI Energy FS. We carry many convenience and essential items at our Gas Bar locations. From softener salt to lottery, energy drinks to coffee and more.
Job description
Gas Bar; Customer service (full time and part time)
The position of Gas Bar attendant requires the ability to process customers’ purchases efficiently and correctly, while delivering friendly and courteous service refuel vehicles. We are looking for dependable, happy customer orientated individual who wants to work. There is a lot of memorizing packages products programs must be able to retain information.
Duties
Greet, assist and thank customers (by name where possible) in a friendly, courteous manner
Operate cash register (all functions) and maintain cash area
Refuel Gas
Flexible hours days/afternoon and weekends
Maintain clean, sanitized workplace
Well organized;
Answer phones, and customer questions
Requirements
Process customer purchases efficiently, following standardized procedures
Maintain a professional appearance (uniform, hygiene, grooming and name tag)
Alert the respective department on any customer inquiry or concern
Follow company policies
Smile Create our Culture
Follow our Core Values
Follow store health & safety program and observe provincial occupational health and safety regulations; report any observed or potential hazards immediately
Participate in meetings and all training, as required
Complete other tasks as required
Ability to provide professional customer service at all times, including situations of conflicts
Ability to provide support and assistance to co-workers
Ability to work in a team environment to achieve common goals
Ability to maintain composure and work effectively in a fast-paced environment
Demonstrate a desire to take on more responsibilities
Ability to adapt to a changing environment
Open to work in other areas
Ability to work with minimum supervision
Organizational ability and attention to detail
Ability to multi-task
Punctuality
Effective written and oral communication skills
Basic math skills
Possess adequate computer skills
Ability to stand/walk/ sit for 9 hours
Ability to lift and turn repeatedly throughout the shift
Must be local (From Listowel, Ontario)

Title: Sales Associate - Oakville, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Great Place to Work® Certified
COBS Bread is growing, and we’re looking for a
Sales Assistant
to join our team. We provide a fun work environment, comprehensive training, and excellent opportunities for career advancement. No experience needed, as long as you have the right attitude and you’re interested in learning new skills!
As a Sales Assistant at COBS Bread, you will:
Work as part of a small team, providing exceptional customer service, and getting to know your regular customers
Be responsible for merchandising product and executing marketing campaigns
Also work alongside your team to keep the bakery clean, and assist with production as needed
Requirements
What we are looking for in a successful candidate:
Strong customer service focus and ability to multitask
Experience in handling cash, credit card and debit transactions are preferred
Relevant retail experience is a strong asset
Positive attitude and friendly demeanour
Reliability and self-motivation, and enjoy learning new skills
A team player who is approachable and enjoys working with people
Takes pride in providing a great and personable experience for our customers
Physical Requirements
Continuous standing/ walking for all tasks
Constant use of both hands, and frequent forceful gripping
Continually operating the POS system
Frequent lifting and carrying up to 7.5 kg., reaching below shoulder level, bending and turning
Occasional lifting and carrying up to 22 kg, pushing, pulling, crouching, bending and reaching above shoulder level
Benefits
What’s in it for you?
A fun work environment with flexible hours
Complimentary products on us every shift
Potential for growth and development opportunities, including certified COBS Bread Sales Training and E-Learning
And more, including benefits for all full time employees
Accessibility Accommodation is available upon request for applicants and employees with disabilities. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure you have access to a fair and equitable process. Any information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially.

Title: Cashier/Customer Service - London, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Are you ready to try something new?
Are you overdue for something fun?
Something that is challenging and rewarding?
Something exciting with great growth opportunities?
We would love for you to join us today!
Preferred availability:
Monday - Friday , alternating weekends
Contact info:
765 Exeter Road, London
519-963-1046
Candidates with a working knowledge and/or working experience merchandising and shelf stocking, working as a cashier or in a commissioned sales environment will be in higher consideration.
Since opening our first store in 1995, Factory Direct has grown to become one of Canada’s largest privately owned closeout retailers.
Currently operating over 18 stores in Ontario, Factory Direct specializes in purchasing large quantities of new, refurbished, end of line, surplus and closeout brand name consumer and office products.
We currently stock over 10,000 different products ranging from computers, electronics, cellular phones, health and beauty, toys and gaming, home and garden, and other seasonal and general merchandise.
As a Factory Direct employee, your duties will include, but not be limited to:
Selling products, services and solutions by getting to know customers and helping solve their unique end to end needs;
Maintaining store merchandising standards;
Asking lifestyle questions to thoroughly understand customer needs, offers relevant services, solutions, and accessories so customer can make informed decision to complete their purchase;
Utilize all relevant sales tools to drive profitable growth;
Leverage on-line resources, tools, and peer knowledge to self train.
Working at Factory Direct will help you:
Learn first-hand how a fast-paced business operates and how commercial decisions are made;
Develop an ability to work under pressure;
Understand the strengths of working in a team and how others in different teams depended on your work;
Acquire self-management skills, the importance of being punctual, flexible, getting work done on time, and being willing to improve your own performance.
Employer: factorydirect.ca
How to Apply: email
Website: http://www.factorydirect.ca
Terms of Employment: Full/Part-Time,

Experience: Experience an asset

Reading text,
